website_summaries.verdict: The Silicon Power Armor A60 is a great deal for those needing a portable drive that can withstand rough handling and tough environments.
pros: The Silicon Power Armor A60 portable drive is fast and affordable
The drive can also withstand drops and dust and is water-resistant
cons: The drive doesn't use a traditional Micro-USB 3.0 cable, it includes no backup software and is slightly bulkier than its peers

customer_reviews.title: Not Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this drive. I own a lot of mobile hard drives and I was in a pinch and bought this boutique shock absorbent external hard-drive. It could not take the road life. I travel a lot but I keep all my hard drives in travel pelican cases. After about 3 months it crapped out and it took hours away from doing actual work recovering the data from this less than rugged hard-drive. I would suggest sticking with a more reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Scott

customer_reviews.title: Functioning Reasonably Priced Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: As expected from other reviews, the rubber clips supposedly holding the usb cable popped off as soon as I detached the cable - I put a rubber band around the drive to hold the cable, and that works much better than the clips. Otherwise, it worked as advertised. I transferred some business files so I'd have another copy of them, and that worked. I just got the drive today, haven't dropped it, haven't had water soak it, just transferred some sensitive files, so I can't give you any long term usage results. Will come back & comment should anything exceptional or disastrous happen, otherwise it's a good functioning hard drive. .
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great as external hard drive for my XboxOne
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Using it as an external arc drive to store my XboxOne games given that I purchased in of the early consoles with limited space. Does great as you can easily run games off the external hard drive without any hiccups in game play. Can also transfer between the XboxOne hard drive and this one quickly. This hard drive comes with a USB cable that can also be attached to 2 rubber clamps that are attached to the hard drive itself for easy transportation. Since the 4 years I’ve owned this have lost one of the little plastic clamps that keeps the USB attached for easy traveling but not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Young

customer_reviews.title: It Died
customer_reviews.text: Using it as an external drive, lasted 4 months and died. Suddenly. No warning. Dead. Can get data back with data retrieval EaseUS software, but is not sorted in files and has no headings so I have no idea what anything is. Took it to Geek Squad. They said it is dead (I knew that!) and would cost about $1900 to retrieve the files but they would have no titles and no folders - just retrieved numbers. If you want to lose everything, if you want something unreliable, if you want a brick to keep your door open, this is for you. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: allanwol

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't risk it.
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it failed three months after I bought it. Unable to erase or reformat it. Bought a new cable for it, but that didn't help. It's a paperweight now. And of course, it's outside the Amazon support window by a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bell Roden

customer_reviews.title: Must had got a defected one
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first few days then I had dropped it. Must had got a defected one or something because it stopped mounting and opened up, the screws were coming out. Got a refund and now going to order once more and hope for the best. I will update my rating soon Edit my review on 6/18 So far drive is working great. Haven’t had any issues. I’ll give it 5 stars. This company made the replacement hassle free with amazon. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Montanez

customer_reviews.title: Great for any user.
customer_reviews.text: This drive seems to work well. It is extremely quiet, and the sleek design makes it easy to have on my desk. The clips do hold the cable in place quite firmly, although they may wear after extended use. The drive is formatted in FAT32, as I would expect it to be for the cross-compatibility it says it has for MacOS and Windows. The drive comes preloaded with software to register it, and the 3 year warranty seems to cover any internal failure so long as it is not intentionally damaged. This would be a great drive to have for any computer enthusiast, or for anyone who wants a data backup for their computer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Luedtke

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work any better than the old ones but it is so much ...
customer_reviews.text: I could put four of these hard drives inside the one I bought 8 years ago. It doesn't work any better than the old ones but it is so much smaller and if it ever has to travel the armor will keep it safe from harm. Also, my old WD required a separate power plug in addition to the USB plug. These smaller modern models get their power thru the USB plug, which is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: snakecatcher2000

customer_reviews.title: I own 3 external hard drives by this company
customer_reviews.text: See how the cord clips nicely to the exterior so you will always have it with you? Well it doesn't stay there. The little clips are made of flexible rubbery plastic and the green rim around the drive is made of soft silicone. The little clips just come right out if you bump the thing. Super annoying. Drive is great otherwise, and I'm very happy with the other two (different rugged models) I own, but don't plan to keep the cord like that.
customer_reviews.author: Pollyessster

customer_reviews.title: Great drive ... Died after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Drive worked great for about 18 months. Then suddenly could not be recognized by any of my computers. It was used on a desk side and was never dropped or abused. I gave it three stars for a year and a half of excellent use. Wish it had lasted longer. Now I have to make sure I have backups for my backup drive.
customer_reviews.author: Fate

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Downloaded my whole computer onto it the same way I would use a flash drive (USB drive). The case holds the cord, which I appreciate so that it doesn’t get separated. I haven’t dropped it, but it seems hefty enough to be able to take a hit. Also not planning on purposefully testing for waterproofing or any other things that might risk it breaking, but if they accidentally happen, I will update my review. So far, I am very pleased with the quality — especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: ejpelaccio

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive SP
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive says that it has 1T but when I start transferring my fils for some reason only half of the space was available on disk even tho it was totally empty. Also for Mac users you need to refresh the disc and go through process that you can transfer files from Mac. Not so happy about it, even tho it’s looks stylish and so light.
customer_reviews.author: Oxana Bukreeva

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold video games
customer_reviews.text: I tried to download several video games using this external hard drive but gives me an error. It says it cannot differentiate between upper and lower case, I have no idea what this means. I am now using it to back up my computer and that is working excellent like it should. It also holds pictures. The only thing that I have had trouble with is trying to download video games which is the reason I purchased this. Great product if you are using it for a back up hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Masoncg

customer_reviews.title: Crashed in a month lost Everything but support helped me working great now.
customer_reviews.text: Got this put all of my stuff I wanted on it worked great and 2 months later it will not work and you can not get ahold of customer service USA or online do not buy this! UPDATE, I have received support and now this product is working great would give 5 star but a little frustrating it crashed after 2 months. You have to eject this everytime I wasn’t aware of that w the usb. You eject it at the bottom of your computer right side by the clock area. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The included cable & the plastic brackets fall off easily, but that is not a problem anyway
customer_reviews.text: Does support USB 3 as claimed, even as 2.0 is enough, as the HDD itself is not a speed beast :) Practical for travel, not expensive, very quiet. The included cable & the plastic brackets fall off easily, but that is not a problem anyway, as those can be put back in seconds. Spillproof indeed, but not waterproof. The green rubber tends to accumulate dirt, clean with non-alcohol solution, or you'll destroy it. Very happy with it. Comes formatted as FAT32, with a small registration app on it (Windows-only), also comes with an html version of it. There is a firmwate update on SP site, applied it, so far, haven't had any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: José Humberto Oliveros Magaña

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage space
customer_reviews.text: Slick little fella love it! Does exactly as I need. Lots and lots of space for the numerous pictures and videos I take. Initially, take out of box plug into computer format immediately. Never again. If you format once pictures are on it - all pictures and videos will be deleted. Speaking from experience.
customer_reviews.author: pudn204

customer_reviews.title: files disappeared few times in 4 month
customer_reviews.text: Bought the external Hard Drive in June, the error messages started in the second month, and the files disappeared few times in 4 months. I would not recommend to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Few disappointments
customer_reviews.text: Color is nice. I don't like the cord holders. They are sharp to the hands. I took them off. The speed is 30% less than my 500GB Silicon Power orange version. Both are 5400 rpm, so I don't know why. I'm talking about making system images for Linux and Windows. Also slower to copy paste 18GB mixed files from a fast SSD.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ion May

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to have a back up!
customer_reviews.text: It worked well while it lasted. It's supposed to have a 3 year warranty, mine is 4 months over that warranty and it stopped working. The computer no longer recognizes it; I tried running the First Aid, Disk Utility function and it didn't work either. It sucks because I had important files that I cannot longer access. I never dropped it, or damaged it; it was stored safely in a pouch in my drawer, yet it stopped working, so... make sure to have a back up!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B.

customer_reviews.title: this has worked great so far
customer_reviews.text: this has worked great so far! If you use a computer you need an external hard drive, period. Computers can crash and you can loss everything, that is what also most happened to me thankfully I was able to recover my material. I am in graduate school so I have a lot of documents and papers I have to keep track and without this I would be lost. I can upload all my documents to this little guy and take this to the school library, hook up to a PC there and work away - no need to lug my laptop around.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: My PS4 Universe Just Got Bigger
customer_reviews.text: Shipped super fast! I love this design and it works perfectly on my original PS4. I only had 500gb of storage on the PS4 and it was filling up. I saw this and liked it instantly. Great price and it looks cool. Barely any noticeable load time delays at all. I already transferred all my game installs and I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Draconisthanos

customer_reviews.title: Cable clips are a design flaw, but have nothing to do with the performance of the HD
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I just wanted to address the cable-clip problem: the clip stay on the cables, by the clips don't stay on the drive unit. It's a bad design, but it doesn't affect the drive at all, duh! I got the "frequently bought together" Amazon case for, like, 6 bucks, and I've taken the clips off, put them in the interior pocket with the cable, and everything is still in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lundstrom

customer_reviews.title: It showed up right away in WIndows 8 and I was able to access it just like any other drive
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a rugged and well protected external hard drive. The USB is the more common full sized and not a mini or printer type which makes it easier to connect with whatever cables I have laying around. The transfer is very fast; Being portable, there's no need for a power cord, it uses the power from the USB cable. It's indeed small enough to fit into a shirt pocket if you're so inclined and the rugged rubberized case should protect it as advertised from a short drop, bounce or water splash. It showed up right away in WIndows 8 and I was able to access it just like any other drive.
customer_reviews.author: Blind Dad

customer_reviews.title: but as they say it's better to have it and not need it than need ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. Sits right next to my first one, you know, the one I bought when I thought 1TB was all the spare room anyone would need. I was wrong so I got another one and it's 3/4 full. Next up is a 3TB and we'll see how long that one lasts. Get the USB 3 if your computer can handle it. I can't imagine what I'd do if I only had USB 2. I've never had the opportunity/misfortune to test the "Rugged Armor" part of the drive and frankly don't want to, but as they say it's better to have it and not need it than need it and not have it.
customer_reviews.author: OkieChef

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable HD
customer_reviews.text: I was in desperate need of an external for my photography. My computer HD was being eaten alive by all of the photos. This portable drive has been a lifesaver. It has tons of space and reads pretty fast. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for a Motorcycle trip
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this for a motorcycle trip, and I was afraid that the shaking would make my other drives die on me. This Hard Drive spent 13 days on a motorcycle case being vibrated constantly for 3-6 hours a day, and it still works, it holds all my photos and videos and never gave me any issues. Thats a win in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Aorata

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive not reading.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hard drive June 19, 2017 on Amazon and it was working fine until February 2018. The hard drive light turns on when it is plugged in on both 2.0 and 3.0 but no drive icon appears. My primary computer is an HP pavillion with Windows 10, but the drive does not appear on my desktop computer either. I store HD in a padded canvas pouch. The part has never been dropped or exposed to water or heat.
customer_reviews.author: David Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Drive that works with car audio system
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with MP3s in the car audio system (Ford Sync). Came preformatted with FAT32, which is what the system needed to see. Worked like a champ. Have about 150 Gig of MP3s and have had no problem playing them. Pros - LED (when drive is connected) will indicate whether connected to USB 2 or 3 by color. Non-skid strips on bottom and bumper around drive. Cons - while it is called a rugged armor drive, the LED shines thru the plastic shell so it can't be that rugged. Shell has a little flex to it also. Seems to be a good drive so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Becarful Mac users!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so for all you Apple folks I would skip over this drive. I could not format this drive to APFS, which meant I​ could not encrypt the drive, therefore, it is useless to me. Additionally, I asked a question before buying and was answered by Silicone Power regarding using this with a USB C cable. They said no problem but recommended I buy their cable. Which I did not because I have plenty of Anker cables at home which is probably better quality. Well no it did not work at all. So I am returning this and going for the cheaper Seagate drives that I know will work for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Owen

customer_reviews.title: This product has failed after 8 months!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive 8 months ago and it has now stopped working. It was not dropped, or not properly removed from the USB port. I've never had a drive just stop working like this after only minimal usage. I've lost important active portable data that wasn't backed up in the last couple of weeks. Do not buy this drive!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann Paynter

customer_reviews.title: Superior ease of use
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect drive for anyone with ease of use beyond my expectations. I just plugged USB into my Mac and it asked if I wanted to back up or/and save to my new drive and voila! I totally recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Crashed after 45 days.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to back up all of my baby’s photos. It crashed 45 days or so after getting it. I’m beyond heart broken. I’m praying it’s the casing that’s the problem and not the hard drive itself or that the data can be recovered. I was in the process of backing up to a cloud as well but hadn’t finished yet. After telling the company in no way should this have crashed in 45 days they offered to attempt a data recovery but I’m not comfortable sending it. I’m scared I won’t get it back and if their people are even any good. So upset.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! This hard drive is really a toy for the road, Serious capacity as it comes in 1T, 2T, 3T, 4T and 5T configuration keeping the same size and the same sturdy armor. With a USB 3.0 interface compatible with 2.0 and a five years warranty... There is no way of going bad with this handy and convenient tool. Ideal for almost any kind of task!
customer_reviews.author: Emmer Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this to use with her playstation 4. She loves it. She says it works perfectly with her toy and that shes already got her many games on it. She said to give it 5/5 for quality but wished it came in more feminine colors (even though she likes the lime green around the edge)
customer_reviews.author: Leslieann Sines

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to abuse!
customer_reviews.text: I am very accident prone and so is the rest of my family. I have another external hard drive that I bought years ago, but with the many times that I have dropped it, or it getting pushed off the counter, it is falling apart. I bought this one hoping it will stay intact through our rough lifestyles and it has proven itself already! We have dropped it a few times already, from a low height, and it has held up! Great investment since I do not want to loose my thousands of pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Trista Karlskin

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection and a Great Price :-)
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying and recommending these to clients! Great shockproof drive that works without any hassles. Skip the markup and lack of protection of an off-the-shelf external drive and order yourself one. Data recovery starts off at a minimum of around $500 for the lab I use, so it is to one's advantage purchase ruggedized drives that offer more piece of mind. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: Faster than you can say DONE!
customer_reviews.text: I could NOT believe how much faster my files copied over to this device! I was copying over many GB (I don't remember how many) over WiFi nonetheless (!) from my Airport time capsule to this silicon power 32 GB stick, hooked up to my macbook air. What I can tell you is that when I first had my older 500 GB external drive hooked up (2.0 USB), I got a message that it would take several hours to complete the transfer. Ok, yeah, I'm doing it wireless. It's gonna be a while. But then I remembered I bought this stick and I hooked it up, and you know what? It was like 20 minutes and I was done. SERIOUSLY!
customer_reviews.author: chandiego

customer_reviews.title: cord issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product an okay because I've had this usb for a few months and it's been great. this is actually the second one of this brand I bought but now the usb cable doesn't work. it's not the standard cable for external hard drives. and replacements are more expensive than the more commonly used usb cable. irritating. aside from that, it's a good product for the price but the cord is unreliable. be prepared to buy replacements
customer_reviews.author: Alesyn McCall

customer_reviews.title: I do NOT have a problem with actual drive, ...
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT have a problem with actual drive, but for some reason Silocon power decided to go with usb to usb cable that's much harder to find. Also USB cable is attached to actual drive, but those rubber pieces are very flimsy and do not stay on the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey P

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great----ONCE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great ONCE! Went to back up my music months later and it won't even register on my mac. inside you can here it spin and grind but nothing. only moved 220+gig of music so it is not full. Restarted and moved ports in case it was my mac - but it just won't register. now I see that they only warranted it for a month - and I am SOL. Rugged - I haven't seen it yet - I just hope this is a fluke and the company will contact me to resolve this issue -im praying for a fluke and some support. Stay Tuned.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmi Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Silicon Power 1TB Xbox PS4 Compatible Rugged...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my sons PS4. 3 stars for unknown hard drive brand and didn't pull it out to check. PS4 just says Silicone Power or whatever. Works so far, no issues as yet. 4th star is for the case. I never "LOVE" on any rating.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: So sad, lasted 11 months before became unrecognizable. Seems every ex hard drive out there has high failure rates and aren't reliable so what are we to do????????? I like revisiting older ps4 games and have more than my ps4 can handle itself!!! What do I do now?
customer_reviews.author: Snake Eyes

customer_reviews.title: but I will say for now that I really love the size
customer_reviews.text: It turns on and appears to work as intended. I will update this review if I have any problems down the road, but I will say for now that I really love the size, weight, feel, and appearance of this little drive. It seems to be a quality purchase at this point so hopefully it will hold up to my travels.
customer_reviews.author: Loka

customer_reviews.title: Works just works
customer_reviews.text: I have dropped many times and no issues. Very well built and protected. Have left hooked up fr days and no issues overheating or slowing down on transfering of materials
customer_reviews.author: Chris Heckel

customer_reviews.title: Will not be recognized by win7 without doing this
customer_reviews.text: Why 3 stars? Because the driver it came with did not work well on Win 7 Home 64. I tried updating the driver for it and non exists. So my win did not recognize it. I looked for solutions and found one: Open Disk Management (Start > Search > diskmgmt.msc) and see what it shows for the external hard drive. You might just have to assign a drive letter to it. then it worked. Why are you selling a drive which has a 2006 driver? 9 years old!!! come on people.
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Shary

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compact compared to my last one, lots of storage, and much easier to use without the extra power cord. I can keep this one handy and can up- or off-load data easily. The cord holder is a good idea but tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This drive has stopped working. I have Samsung external hard drives that 8 years old that have functioned flawlessly. I’ve only had this for 2 years and it stopped working out of nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recognized instantly but cable attachment is easily lost.
customer_reviews.text: Recognized instantly by laptop and able to write. Easily formatted for exFat larger files. A little dissapointed in the cable attachment as the small holders easily pop out and get lost. I got this specifically so that whenever I grabbed it the cable would be there.
customer_reviews.author: rkruz

customer_reviews.title: He was having to delete games because he'd run out of storage so this one should keep him happy for a while
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 15 year old grandson, to use with his XBox. He was having to delete games because he'd run out of storage so this one should keep him happy for a while. Big smile when he opened it, and that's hard to attain when I'm shopping for a teenaged boy!
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: so far i have no complaits but did not like the old fat32
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about buying it after reading some of the reviews,so far i have no complaits but did not like the old fat32,i could not load any large files off my go pro cam,so i did reformat it to ntfs format,it actually works better and faster im happy with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Unreliable DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who is writing these reviews, but this product is garbage. I bought FOUR of them about a year ago and two of them are already trashed. Plugged them into my computer and the message said, DRIVE IS CORRUPTED. Garbage, Garbage Garbage. Unreliable Unreliable Unreliable. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Twain

customer_reviews.title: It's a great quality drive that doesn't have the price tag of ...
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a workhorse in my house. It's a great quality drive that doesn't have the price tag of Western Digital, Seagate, or Toshiba brand items. It's a mechanical drive, and just holds backups, so it didn't need to be anything special. I'd buy another one again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parduhn

customer_reviews.title: Good product but beware the non-standard cable
customer_reviews.text: Like it so far. I haven't dropped it yet, but I know it's just a matter of time. My biggest complaint about it is that it has uses the large size USB plug instead of a micro. Why?? Every other gadget I own has a micro-usb port, and now I have to keep track of this unit's cable that has no other purpose. I ended up buying a "USB A Male to Micro USB Female Adapter" for my unit that somewhat makes the issue better.
customer_reviews.author: User1234

customer_reviews.title: Not fast, but otherwise AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest in the world (hence the loss of one star), but otherwise? I love this thing! I've now had this drive for over 4 months, and I use it to store photos and ebooks that I can't keep on my laptop. I feel like I could throw this drive into the nearest puddle, and my terabyte of data would be just fine. It's easy to keep track of the USB cable with the silicone "divot" all around the top of the drive, and the neon green strip ensures that I can see it in my luggage, on the floor of my car, and in my purse! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Sharilyn Twidwell

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while and suddenly I plugged it in ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had both the 1 TB and the 2TB and encountered the same problem as other reviewers. Worked fine for a while and suddenly I plugged it in and it says needs reformatting. In all instances this happened when moving it from one computer to another so it was working fine and then minutes later stopped. Extremely inconvenient to lose data due to drive failure like this. It most certainly does not live up to the manufacturer claims. If it had happened with one drive I might give them the benefit of the doubt but two...not at all!
customer_reviews.author: Nerissa

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, wierd connector
customer_reviews.text: I was very Leary to get this due to the negative reviews. However, after looking through them close it seems like one or two people wrote them over and over. My unit is lighting fast and works great. It'll be interesting to see the life I get from it. I am adding this update over 2 years later. Drive works fine and no issues to report. Oh, and the double make USB connector is odd. No big deal, just odd.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: this has got to be the best external USB drive I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: In my humble opinion, this has got to be the best external USB drive I've ever had. I used to be biased and only bought WD drives, but even a drop from six inches can render those inoperative. These have had water spilled on them, been hit, been dropped from those six inches, and I still have access to all my data! Yep. A definite recommend on these. I have 2 of them now. Plan on buying a third. This is what happens when your PC has several terabytes of HDD storage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rendon

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY-BUY A KNOWN REPUTABLE BRAND
customer_reviews.text: Buy from a brand that sticks by their product. Horrible external HD. Not even 2 months after purchase it has encountered a hardware error and now I lost all my data and the HD can not be formatted.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Construction is top notch, clearly heavy duty and I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Construction is top notch, clearly heavy duty and I'm not worried about dropping it or anything. The cord is standard male USB to standard male USB which is a little odd. If you lose it you'll have to get a replacement somewhere, and the way it attaches to the drive is a little suspect so I assume I'll probably misplace it at some point in the future. Drive works well with Windows as well as Mac OS
customer_reviews.author: John Othic

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough to travel
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to the fact I can carry a TB in a case just a little bigger than a cell phone. Has held up well through lots of use. Great for mobile office days. Carries my entire iTunes collection so it doesn't clog up the tablet's storage.
customer_reviews.author: deannab

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive arrived a day early, which is fantastic, and set-up was a breeze. I maintained the MS-DOS (FAT) file system that was pre-formatted on the drive so that it is useful not only on my Mac, but also on my gaming consoles. The drive operates quickly and quietly and I am excited to have doubled my external storage volume.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This baby so far has not caused me issues. It's not exactly 1T but it looks sturdy and could handle a fall. The cable doesnt stay in place too well so still put it in a nice bag or keep it in your purse.
customer_reviews.author: Chickoraa

customer_reviews.title: It's very tough and has lasted me a long time
customer_reviews.text: This HD has lasted me for a long time. It has taken quite a bit of beating too as I hauled it around in my backpack for nearly a year straight. It survived through Mexico and many other adventures. I definitely recommend for those who aren't too gentle on their electronics!
customer_reviews.author: Bilbo Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good... until it suddenly dies on you
customer_reviews.text: Treated it with care, and it suddenly died after about 2 1/2 years. Some external hard drives will start 'acting up' before they die, giving you a chance to transfer your data before it finally goes for good. Not this one! Working perfectly, and then... BAM! Laterz, family pictures. Not exactly what I would call reliable. If it's a backup to your backup's backup... maybe give it a go. As a main backup? Nope!
customer_reviews.author: nurunuru

customer_reviews.title: minor defect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: durable, not too big, drive works fine, fair price Cons: cord/cable along with attachment pegs do not stay on very well (when not in use). This makes them fall off and can easy get lost.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I liked it so much, I bought two of 'em
customer_reviews.text: Love this drive so much, I bought two of them. I use one as a music player in my car, and it performs flawlessly. Transferring files into it is really fast, and it does hold up well if you're a klutz. A friend dropped my drive on the concrete (yes, we're still friends), and it's like nothing ever happened. No skips, no crazy errors, and as worry-free as the day it arrived. Good value, great drive.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Made strong for life
customer_reviews.text: Only external hard drive that can withstand going through washing machine cycle & nail polish poured in usb port. Still works great. My files are safe!
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: This hard drive rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something a little more up-to-date from a bulky 350gb external drive I was using from an old operating system, and am super glad I went with the Silicon Power A60. Out of the box it was super easy to format, partition, and back up files as I needed with my Mac. It's size and supportive padding make a great lightweight yet incredibly sturdy piece of equipment, as the device itself is just a little bit bigger than an S5 and probably matches the size of a Note phone or other phablet. Definitely go with this HD, it does everything it's supposed to do and is damn near impossible to break.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Straub

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. I haven't tested the shockproof-ness of it and have no plans to do so, but I didn't really buy it for that. The cable doesn't stay well on the keepers, but who cares. My biggest problem is that I'm partially color-blind and didn't realize the trim is neon-lime-green. An OD green would have suited me better, but, oh, well, it's not like it's a shirt or something else I would wear, so I'll live, I reckon.
customer_reviews.author: FLAFarmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and rugged.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my seagate, this one feels good for those that's always on the go. I use this mainly for my music and videos. It's been great. The only knock is that the plastic tabs on each side of it that holds the USB cable keeps coming off and I always have to look for it. That is all.
customer_reviews.author: Thavaro

customer_reviews.title: Love If
customer_reviews.text: no complains its Chucked filled with Series a friend downloaded and connected to my Flat screen 4KUHD TV and i use it there. Be careful with the little things that hold the cord on the side they can come off and get lost if you tug at it too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and useful, compatible with mac/win
customer_reviews.text: No problem with the hard drive!! It comes with a program that can be installed only on a windows pc, the format is in Fat32 and you can use ir with a mac without any problems, very useful to store whatever you want. Talking about the hardshell, it seems to be durable and good quality, i've never tried to throw it, but i hope my disk will survive. Its compatible with time capsule for mac users. Greets!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Moya Sepulveda

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Design and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice Design and easy to use. I bought this for my uncle who has unfortunately been the victim of malware and viruses. This is a plug and play device, no issues connecting it to his computer and initiating a full back. Highly recommend. He like the rugged design and how the cable is stored right with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Norris

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your precious information
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing is a nice way of expressing my feelings for this product. Durable is not what this product is about. After having it for a month the USB connection started failing and has eventually seized to work. You have to spend 30 minutes trying to get the hardrive to work so that you can transfer off the precious information you trusted the "Rugged" external hardrive to protect.
customer_reviews.author: Adele Clare-Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Mikey Likes It!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Using this to replace an older external hard drive, transferred everything over to this one, and so far, it is working great! I keep my itunes music on it. I like it so much, that I bought another one for my Daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Portable Storage
customer_reviews.text: Good little flash storage. So far this thing has lived up to its description, depending on the computer I've had write speeds go from the drive to my desktop (which as SS USB 3.0 ports) as high as 110mb/s as burst speeds then it goes down to 43-60mb/s transfers. Writing TO the drive is a bit slower ranging from 33-44mb/s also varying on different computers. Will update this review when/if it dies as to give an example of it's lifespan if its too short.
customer_reviews.author: Grunt 117

customer_reviews.title: Go and store
customer_reviews.text: Great, it is drop resistant. There is a limit for the size of the file transferred at once, but there are ways around that. I would definitely buy again, but not in the future because I don't enjoy spending money. This was the exception. Pros Has a very nice case around the hardware fast download smaller than I thought Very pleasant experience Plug and literally play Cons Wish it could transfer really big files (it may can, still playing around with it) an internal storage for the usb cable
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good..
customer_reviews.text: So far so good...my previous external corrupted some folders with pictures of my kids...I was devastated! Now I have two SP externals so I have a backup. I did some research and this company came up the best for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Kibbles

customer_reviews.title: HUGE + must re-format for MacBook
customer_reviews.text: This thing is much bigger than pictures make it look! You also have to reformat the device for MacBook before it is recognized by your computer, that didn't take time to figure out haha. And the company doesn't have any support in English really haha. just save your time and get the SSD drive.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Torres

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully! One minor flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This works beautifully and is so light and compact. I only have one very minor complaint. The part that attaches the cord to the actual device pops off very easily. I wish that the connecting part was actually a part of the overall device.
customer_reviews.author: SHK

customer_reviews.title: My first USB 3.0 device
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality hardware; great feel in the hand and very heavy duty feel. Every bit of the TB was onboard and present. Finally, the wow factor. I backed up 100GB of data from a fresh build in...12 minutes. 12 minutes. Up/down is crazy fast! Cons - none. One of the best external drives out there; very highly recommended. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam H

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly slow drive (30 MB/s write speed) and very high latency. The drive is in a cheap plastic enclosure with a thin green strip of silicone/rubber on the outside (the product image is very misleading). This drive is not "rugged" at all and would most likely fail just by being knocked off of a desk.
customer_reviews.author: Wazit Tooya

customer_reviews.title: Everything I could have wanted in an external drive!
customer_reviews.text: A very good device to store tons of games, movies, tv shows, music, or whatever media you'd like. I have so much stored on it and yet it's not even halfway full. The USB 3.0 makes data transfers very fast(as long as you have the 3.0 jacks). The only thing that I have found that is wrong with this product is that the little black things that hold the USB cable come off very easily. They can go back on, but they are easily lost. All in all 5/5 stars! Edit: Have had this for almost a year now and still working good as ever.
customer_reviews.author: bulletpark

customer_reviews.title: How light it is with no drivers to install
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied and it worked the exact way it described in the details. I love how light it feels
customer_reviews.author: Floydie410

customer_reviews.title: A Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: My mac book air has literally no storage since i just bought the cheapest one and this has cleared out so much of my store and given me peace of mind. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if they had extras that came with it that would of been cool.
customer_reviews.text: WOULD OF GOTTA a 5 star but after 2 weeks of usage the little clips on the side holding the usb3 cord fall off and was never to be found again! if they had extras that came with it that would of been cool.
customer_reviews.author: Meng

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and value--highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable drive! I purchased two of these for storing videos and photos and they are so worth the money. Great performance in terms of speedy transfers and ease of use (I have an iMac desktop). It is extremely easy to use--just plug it in and you are good to go. The size and rugged casing with good price point make this a no brainier. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: Really well made, easy to use, and we bought it in the nick of time as my hard drive died within a week after we bought it. So glad we had this and had backed up my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Ok but didn't live up to expectation
customer_reviews.text: It was ok for about a year. Then one day just stopped working. Only used it for my ps4 never reformatted it or anything since I got it. I have over 200 dollars worth of games on it and now I have to buy a new hard drive and all those games as well. I was impressed with what it offered but disappointed in the shelf life of Being indoors and never moved.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan D.

customer_reviews.title: not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Good drive. The only issue I have with this is a design flaw with the way the cord attaches for storage. It attaches by little rubber mujiggers that fit into a groove that goes along the sides of the drive. The problem is that every time I take the cord on or off to use it the stupid rubber thinga mujiggers pop out. Lucky I haven't lost them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Couch

customer_reviews.title: dependable external drive
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this to several troubleshooting trips on the field, and it continues to serve me well. The wrap-around cable channel on the side is not as useful to me as I originally thought it would be. It seems just a gimmick to me. But it's not a deal breaker. The hard drive does what it's supposed to do, and it's worry free to lug around.
customer_reviews.author: Gao Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Worx on Xbox1
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, easy hookup. Xbox recognised it almost instantly. Perfect for extra space lap top and Xbox1
customer_reviews.author: Kurdt X. Vampille

customer_reviews.title: Shorter life than expected
customer_reviews.text: Have had a year and a half. Worked fine until the last couple of weeks when it became completely unusable. It would say some files are corrupted, now the whole drive can't even be detected by my computer. I had backed it up, thankfully, but it still doesn't function even after reformating it and copying my files back onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Convenient and holds lots of stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Convenient and holds lots of stuff. It is rugged and durable. The only negative I've experienced with it is that the little piece that holds the cord to the side of the drive is prone to coming out of its groove.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Great Product and a great price. I have not had it long enough to test it all around and hope I never have to test the shockproof side of it. I dropped my old one which was another brand and I lost all the data. The one and only time it was dropped it was rendered useless. So far this is a great product will update once I use it more. I do travel a lot so it will be used and abused.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Havent put the "rugged armor" title to the test simply because I am almost certain something will break, and ive already got far too many movies on this thing. The hooks that hold the usb cable in place can easily be lost so keep that in mind. Ive already lost one so now there is no point in hanging the cable on the drive. Other than that, works like a charm so get it.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Pino

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating. It works but only it's your constantly reminding ...
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating. It works but only it's your constantly reminding Xbox that it's there. Won't save to it automatically no matter how many times you set it to. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: Farmers daughter

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again
customer_reviews.text: Had some initial setup problems with my laptop recognizing it, but their customer service got the problem solved. No trouble since.
customer_reviews.author: Howie'sgirl

customer_reviews.title: What a nice product this is
customer_reviews.text: What a nice product this is. The design and color scheme is top notch. I connects super fast to my PC and MAC computers. I only wish that this model had security software incorporated so I could encrpt the files. Otherwise its a great product. Highly recommended with is high shockproof design.
customer_reviews.author: Washdog32

customer_reviews.title: Not PS4 Compatible!!
customer_reviews.text: You state this is for a PS4 in the title of your product, but this certainly does NOT work for Playstation 4!
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

product_meta.title: Silicon Power Black 1TB Rugged Portable External Hard Drive Armor A60, Shockproof USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, Xbox and PS4, Black
product_meta.description:
Capacity:1TB| Color:Black-Green

No More Deleting Your Favorite Games
The Armor A60 allows you to easily free up the storage of your console's internal drive for Xbox and PS4. Just plug the A60 directly into your USB port on your Xbox or PlayStation 4 console and run through an easy setup process within just a few minutes, and you will have more space to store your latest games.

Military-grade Shockproof & Water-resistant
Armor A60 incorporates ultra-rugged rubber casing and internal suspension system, which enable perfect buffer effect and assure rigid protections against crushes, dust and spraying water.

Cable-carry Design
The innovative slot design is equipped for simple cable carrying and storing.

Anti-slip, Anti-scratch
Armor A60 exercises the special surface texture that can not only allow anti-slip function but also keep the drive from damages caused by fingerprints and scratches.

Ultra-fast Transfer Speed
SuperSpeed USB 3.0 interface enables blazing-fast speed performance to quickly transfer large files including HD videos, high-resolution photos and great numbers of documents in seconds.

3-year Warranty
The Armor A60 is backed by a 3-year warranty that guarantees complete services and technical support.

Box Contains
1 x Silicon Power Armor A60 External Hard Drive
1 x USB 3.0 Cable

*MUST READ – 4GB Large File Transferring*
The A60 is pre-formatted to FAT32, so you could use it directly on Mac or Windows without formatting. However, if you’d like to transfer a single file larger than 4GB, please re-format the drive to exFAT before doing so. (*Please backup your drive before reformat.)
feature_bullets: [PS4 / XBOX COMPATIBLE] Ideal for gaming enthusiasts Xbox One, Xbox 360, PS4, PS4 Pro and PS4 Slim (PS4 System Software version 4.50 or higher)
[ALL-ROUND DATA PROTECTION] Military-grade shockproof and IPX4 water-resistant protection
[NO MORE MISSING CABLES] Cable-carry design for easy cable storage
[For Mac Users] Reformatting will be required for Mac operating systems
*Must Read* [For Windows User] The A60 is pre-formatted as NTFS, so you could use it directly on Windows.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,586 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
